channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large branch has snapped off covering footpath, 22nd June
item.description:
Needs cutting off and removing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ground crater in garden, 22nd June
item.description:
I live at 26 Old Farm Road West which sits on the corner of Old Farm Avenue. There is a tree situated on Old Farm Avenue which overlooks our garden and is having an adverse affect to our garden. The grass within our garden has a “sunken bowl” which appears to be a side affect of the root routes/water intake, it provides too much shading which has caused plants to die and limits grass growth and it also causes heave on the pavement adjacent to our garden. We would like to enquire the removal of this tree or at least assistance with the pruning of the tree to make it smaller/less imposing on our boundary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge branch has fallen on my car and has caused significant damage, 22nd June
item.description:
As you can see from the pictures i have uploaded a huge long branch has fallen from one of the trees on the victoria embankment causing significant damage on the vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Embankment, Holborn, City of Westminster

item.title: Long grass., 22nd June
item.description:
I was visiting in Whippendell way St Paul's Cray, and i saw the weeds on the embankment in front of the houses have wildly over grown, I do understand the bees need it but it is over grown. It does need urgent attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Whippendell Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish overflowing, 22nd June
item.description:
The bins are full by late afternoon Saturday and rubbish blows out everywhere. They need to be emptied mid afternoon on Saturday and again mid afternoon on Sunday. So many people and so much rubbish. It otherwise litters the street and the surrounding properties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Decomposing fox at end of small wood behind playground., 22nd June
item.description:
The fox is covered in maggots, stinks and a health hazard if touched. Children often play in the woods there. To find it take the path alongside allotment in the woods and where it turns right near the end go straight ahead on a slight rise. Fox is there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crescent Drive, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continues issue with flat bins, 22nd June
item.description:
Bins overflowing, foxes spread the rubbish everywhere. Sanitary towels and other waste exposed to the street. Can someone please explain to me why this has not been resolved with an additional bin or more regular collections as it is easily fixed and is very depressing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lorrimore Road, Walworth, London
